title: Digital Banking & Modern Payments

sections.title: The Shift to Digital Banking
sections.content:
Modern banking has moved from physical branches to digital platforms. This transformation is driven by customer demand for convenience and speed.

- **Online Banking**: Accessing bank services through a web browser.
- **Mobile Banking**: Using dedicated apps on smartphones to manage accounts, pay bills, and transfer money.
- **Neobanks**: Also known as 'Challenger Banks', these are banks that operate exclusively online without traditional physical branches (e.g., Revolut, N26).

sections.title: Payment Technology
sections.content:
The way we pay for goods and services is changing rapidly.

- **Contactless Payments**: Using NFC (Near Field Communication) technology to pay by tapping a card or phone.
- **Digital Wallets**: Apps like Apple Pay or Google Pay that store card information securely.
- **Real-time Payments**: Instant transfers between bank accounts, available 24/7.
- **APIs in Banking**: Tools that allow different financial apps to talk to each other securely.

sections.title: Language Focus: Future Perfect & Continuous
sections.content:
When talking about digital trends, we often project into the future.

- **Future Continuous**: For actions that will be in progress at a specific time in the future.
  - 'By next year, most customers **will be using** mobile apps for all their banking.'
- **Future Perfect**: For actions that will be completed by a certain point in the future.
  - 'By 2030, many banks **will have closed** their physical branches.'
